Navigate to other release versions of Doxee Platform Composer

[6.6](https://docs.doxee.com/docs/en/composer-6-6)

[6.7](https://docs.doxee.com/docs/en/composer-6-7)

Text element in the Composer is used to display and edit basic text. Element supports various font styling, sizing, alignment or coloring properties. Element also supports spellcheck and various AI transformation features which will be described in more details later. Addition and modification of text is possible in the unprotected areas of the document, which are configurable with the Editability feature. A list of key shortcuts which may be useful for text editing is in the appendix.

## Text properties
### Font Type
Font type and size of editable text portions can be set using the following right panel section.

![](data:image/png;base64,)

*Right panel – Fonts*

In order to change these, select the corresponding text string and choose the desired formatting in the right panel.

In contrast to the other height and width settings in the Composer, font size (as is customary in other spreadsheet programs) is always given in points. The available font types are dependent of the current configuration - loaded based on configuration and availability on the server, however some basic fonts are always present.

### Font Style
Similarly to the font type (Typeface), you can change the font style using the following right panel section. Select the text to be formatted and then choose one or more options: *Bold,*

*Italic, Underline, Overline, Strikethrough*

*![](data:image/png;base64,)*

*Toolbar – Font style*

### Text Alignment
The horizontal text alignment determines the appearance and arrangement of paragraphs, for which the following settings are available in the floating toolbar and right panel:

- &nbsp;![](data:image/png;base64,) Align Left - aligns the left paragraph border parallel to the left page margin.

- &nbsp;![](data:image/png;base64,) Center - centers each line of the paragraph with the page left and right margins.

- &nbsp;![](data:image/png;base64,) Align Right - aligns the right paragraph border parallel to the right page margin.

- &nbsp;![](data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAABsAAAAbCAIAAAACtmMCAAAAnklEQVRIDe1VMQ4DMQhj4r/9BA+tN3+AJUOHnNBJp0OCY2rLEKGEOLaRgqzpkLWWu5ME8K4HAJLuHsTE3XtY59cBBKiQPJ+1c5KbpjwnuEkAOBDbpK4XvwPRzF43YWYd1aoqN6GqHcTrnXwn60yid9tQVp3o3Tb8VUe7ss5EUSnJEH+z1yX7ojjzMYpKyYE4/4fPz5n5WTg/r7edg+sHqU/6n1jIXesAAAAASUVORK5CYII=) Justify - aligns the left and right paragraph borders parallel to the corresponding page margins.

To change the text alignment of a paragraph, place the mouse pointer in the paragraph and choose one of the previously described functions from the context menu, floating toolbar or right panel. Several contiguous paragraphs can be selected with the mouse pointer and their alignments can be set in similar manner.

The horizontal text alignment and additional paragraph settings can also be set with the Paragraph Properties section in right panel. See Chapter 2.15 for details.

### Foreground and Background Color
To set the foreground - ![](data:image/png;base64,)or background - ![](data:image/png;base64,) color, select the editable text portion and click on the corresponding icon in the floating toolbar or right panel. Then a dialog (color picker) opens which expects a color to be chosen. This is illustrated in the following.

![](data:image/png;base64,)

*Foreground Color Picker*

Choose a color with both color sliders. Confirmation is not needed - your selection is applied. If you know the color code you want then alternatively you can use the text fields for defining color. There are the following systems:

- RGB

color determined with additive mixing of three basic colors red, green, and blue in values from 0 to 255.

- Hex #

corresponds to conversion of the RGB value from decimal to hexadecimal.

- HSL

determines color according to hue, saturation, and luminosity.

### Super and Subscript
To enable the super - ![](data:image/png;base64,) or the sub - ![](data:image/png;base64,) select the editable text portion and click on the corresponding icon in the toolbar.

![](data:image/png;base64,)

*Super and subscript example*
